A22 National A12-20, A24 2,,q>A wider definition of AIDS to include dementia and emaciation proposed by Federal officials would increase the number of cases by nearly 20 percent and make major benefits available to thousands more patients. A1 AIDS tests should be mandatory in some situations and health authorities should notify sexual partners of those infected with the deadly virus, Education Secretary William J. Bennett said. A18 Farmers have started buying land that was taken over by major agricultural lenders. The purchases reflect a new optimism about the farm economy, which has been in recession for much of this decade. A1 The new F.B.I. Director may be former Gov. Dick Thornburgh of Pennsylvania, who has been approached by the Administration, White House officials said. A14 5 lawmakers urged the resignation of Thomas M. Roberts from the Nuclear Regulatory Commission. The five Democrats accused him of having destroyed official documents implicating him in misconduct. A24 Washington Talk A16 The cars Congress drives On Rowny's dissent Regional B1-4, B28 2,4.3,q>Three men were charged with arson in the fire in an unoccupied house on their Queens block that was set to shelter six foster-care infants. Officials said the arrests were based on statements by other neighbors. A1 Detectives investigated the body of a bullet-riddled man in Staten Island who resembled a man who had been beaten and abducted soon after a gunman reportedly fired at John Gotti in Queens. B1 New Yorkers will save $305 million in personal income taxes next year because of Federal tax changes and a small cut in the city income tax, city officials announced. B1 A possible failure to brace steel columns as required by engineering plans may have contributed to the collapse of a Bridgeport, Conn., apartment building last week, experts close to the investigation said. B2 News analysis: Bernhard H. Goetz's lead defense lawyer, Barry I. Slotnick, seeks not only to defend his client, but also to prove that the four youths shot by Mr. Goetz were conspiring to rob him. B3 A system of judge shopping that allowed some defendants to select lenient judges for sentencing will end in Manhattan's Federal District Court. Starting July 1, all criminal cases will be assigned randomly. B1 A new ethics code is being drafted, Republican leaders of the New York State Senate said. They said the measure met several of the conditions set by Governor Cuomo when he vetoed another code as too weak. B4 A car with a jammed accelerator ran out of control at Madison Avenue and 40th Street and struck 10 people as it mounted sidewalks, cut a swath through crowds and overturned food-vending stands.
